verses.verse: How <S%H349><s%> doth the city <S%H5892><s%> sit <S%H3427><s%> solitary, <S%H910><s%> that was full <S%H7227><s%> of people! <S%H5971><s%> how is she become <S%H1961><s%> as a widow! <S%H490><s%> she that was great <S%H7227><s%> among the nations, <S%H1471><s%> and princess <S%H8282><s%> among the provinces, <S%H4082><s%> how is she become <S%H1961><s%> tributary! <S%H4522><s%>

She weepeth sore <S%H1058><s%> <S%H1058><s%> in the night, <S%H3915><s%> and her tears <S%H1832><s%> are on <S%H5921><s%> her cheeks: <S%H3895><s%> among all <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3605><s%> her lovers <S%H157><s%> she hath none <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> her: all <S%H3605><s%> her friends <S%H7453><s%> have dealt treacherously <S%H898><s%> with her, they are become <S%H1961><s%> her enemies. <S%H341><s%>

Judah <S%H3063><s%> is gone into captivity <S%H1540><s%> because of affliction, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6040><s%> and because of great <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7230><s%> servitude: <S%H5656><s%> she <S%H1931><s%> dwelleth <S%H3427><s%> among the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> she findeth <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> rest: <S%H4494><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her persecutors <S%H7291><s%> overtook <S%H5381><s%> her between <S%H996><s%> the straits. <S%H4712><s%>

The ways <S%H1870><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%> do mourn, <S%H57><s%> because none <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1097><s%> come <S%H935><s%> to the solemn feasts: <S%H4150><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her gates <S%H8179><s%> are desolate: <S%H8074><s%> her priests <S%H3548><s%> sigh, <S%H584><s%> her virgins <S%H1330><s%> are afflicted, <S%H3013><s%> and she <S%H1931><s%> is in bitterness. <S%H4843><s%>

Her adversaries <S%H6862><s%> are <S%H1961><s%> the chief, <S%H7218><s%> her enemies <S%H341><s%> prosper; <S%H7951><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath afflicted <S%H3013><s%> her for <S%H5921><s%> the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of her transgressions: <S%H6588><s%> her children <S%H5768><s%> are gone <S%H1980><s%> into captivity <S%H7628><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the enemy. <S%H6862><s%>

And from <S%H4480><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her beauty <S%H1926><s%> is departed: <S%H3318><s%> her princes <S%H8269><s%> are become <S%H1961><s%> like harts <S%H354><s%> that find <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> pasture, <S%H4829><s%> and they are gone <S%H1980><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> strength <S%H3581><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the pursuer. <S%H7291><s%>

Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of her affliction <S%H6040><s%> and of her miseries <S%H4788><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her pleasant things <S%H4262><s%> that <S%H834><s%> she had <S%H1961><s%> in the days <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> when her people <S%H5971><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the enemy, <S%H6862><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> did help <S%H5826><s%> her: the adversaries <S%H6862><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> her, and did mock <S%H7832><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> her sabbaths. <S%H4868><s%>

Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> hath grievously sinned; <S%H2398><s%> <S%H2399><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> she is <S%H1961><s%> removed: <S%H5206><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that honored <S%H3513><s%> her despise <S%H2151><s%> her, because <S%H3588><s%> they have seen <S%H7200><s%> her nakedness: <S%H6172><s%> yea, <S%H1571><s%> she <S%H1931><s%> sigheth, <S%H584><s%> and turneth <S%H7725><s%> backward. <S%H268><s%>

Her filthiness <S%H2932><s%> is in her skirts; <S%H7757><s%> she remembereth <S%H2142><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> her last end; <S%H319><s%> therefore she came down <S%H3381><s%> wonderfully: <S%H6382><s%> she had no <S%H369><s%> comforter. <S%H5162><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> behold <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> my affliction: <S%H6040><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> the enemy <S%H341><s%> hath magnified <S%H1431><s%> himself.

The adversary <S%H6862><s%> hath spread out <S%H6566><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> her pleasant things: <S%H4261><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> she hath seen <S%H7200><s%> that the heathen <S%H1471><s%> entered <S%H935><s%> into her sanctuary, <S%H4720><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> thou didst command <S%H6680><s%> that they should not <S%H3808><s%> enter <S%H935><s%> into thy congregation. <S%H6951><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> her people <S%H5971><s%> sigh, <S%H584><s%> they seek <S%H1245><s%> bread; <S%H3899><s%> they have given <S%H5414><s%> their pleasant things <S%H4262><s%> for meat <S%H400><s%> to relieve <S%H7725><s%> the soul: <S%H5315><s%> see, <S%H7200><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and consider; <S%H5027><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> I am become <S%H1961><s%> vile. <S%H2151><s%>

Is it nothing <S%H3808><s%> to <S%H413><s%> you, all <S%H3605><s%> ye that pass by? <S%H5674><s%> <S%H1870><s%> behold, <S%H5027><s%> and see <S%H7200><s%> if <S%H518><s%> there be <S%H3426><s%> any sorrow <S%H4341><s%> like unto my sorrow, <S%H4341><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is done <S%H5953><s%> unto me, wherewith <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath afflicted <S%H3013><s%> me in the day <S%H3117><s%> of his fierce <S%H2740><s%> anger. <S%H639><s%>

From above <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4791><s%> hath he sent <S%H7971><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> into my bones, <S%H6106><s%> and it prevaileth against <S%H7287><s%> them: he hath spread <S%H6566><s%> a net <S%H7568><s%> for my feet, <S%H7272><s%> he hath turned <S%H7725><s%> me back: <S%H268><s%> he hath made <S%H5414><s%> me desolate <S%H8074><s%> and faint <S%H1739><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day. <S%H3117><s%>

The yoke <S%H5923><s%> of my transgressions <S%H6588><s%> is bound <S%H8244><s%> by his hand: <S%H3027><s%> they are wreathed, <S%H8276><s%> and come up <S%H5927><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> my neck: <S%H6677><s%> he hath made my strength <S%H3581><s%> to fall, <S%H3782><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> hath delivered <S%H5414><s%> me into their hands, <S%H3027><s%> from whom I am not able <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> to rise up. <S%H6965><s%>

The Lord <S%H136><s%> hath trodden under foot <S%H5541><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my mighty <S%H47><s%> men in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of me: he hath called <S%H7121><s%> an assembly <S%H4150><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me to crush <S%H7665><s%> my young men: <S%H970><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> hath trodden <S%H1869><s%> the virgin, <S%H1330><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> as in a winepress. <S%H1660><s%>

For <S%H5921><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things I <S%H589><s%> weep; <S%H1058><s%> mine eye, <S%H5869><s%> mine eye <S%H5869><s%> runneth down <S%H3381><s%> with water, <S%H4325><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the comforter <S%H5162><s%> that should relieve <S%H7725><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> is far <S%H7368><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> me: my children <S%H1121><s%> are <S%H1961><s%> desolate, <S%H8074><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the enemy <S%H341><s%> prevailed. <S%H1396><s%>

Zion <S%H6726><s%> spreadeth forth <S%H6566><s%> her hands, <S%H3027><s%> and there is none <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> her: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath commanded <S%H6680><s%> concerning Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> that his adversaries <S%H6862><s%> should be round about <S%H5439><s%> him: Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> is <S%H1961><s%> as a menstruous woman <S%H5079><s%> among <S%H996><s%> them.

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> is righteous; <S%H6662><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> I have rebelled <S%H4784><s%> against his commandment: <S%H6310><s%> hear, <S%H8085><s%> I pray you, <S%H4994><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> and behold <S%H7200><s%> my sorrow: <S%H4341><s%> my virgins <S%H1330><s%> and my young men <S%H970><s%> are gone <S%H1980><s%> into captivity. <S%H7628><s%>

I called <S%H7121><s%> for my lovers, <S%H157><s%> but they <S%H1992><s%> deceived <S%H7411><s%> me: my priests <S%H3548><s%> and mine elders <S%H2205><s%> gave up the ghost <S%H1478><s%> in the city, <S%H5892><s%> while <S%H3588><s%> they sought <S%H1245><s%> their meat <S%H400><s%> to relieve <S%H7725><s%> <S%H853><s%> their souls. <S%H5315><s%>

Behold, <S%H7200><s%> O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> I am in distress: <S%H6862><s%> my bowels <S%H4578><s%> are troubled; <S%H2560><s%> mine heart <S%H3820><s%> is turned <S%H2015><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> me; for <S%H3588><s%> I have grievously rebelled: <S%H4784><s%> <S%H4784><s%> abroad <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2351><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%> bereaveth, <S%H7921><s%> at home <S%H1004><s%> there is as death. <S%H4194><s%>

They have heard <S%H8085><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> I <S%H589><s%> sigh: <S%H584><s%> there is none <S%H369><s%> to comfort <S%H5162><s%> me: all <S%H3605><s%> mine enemies <S%H341><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> of my trouble; <S%H7451><s%> they are glad <S%H7797><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> hast done <S%H6213><s%> it: thou wilt bring <S%H935><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> that thou hast called, <S%H7121><s%> and they shall be <S%H1961><s%> like unto me. <S%H3644><s%>

Let all <S%H3605><s%> their wickedness <S%H7451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> thee; and do <S%H5953><s%> unto them, as <S%H834><s%> thou hast done <S%H5953><s%> unto me for <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my transgressions: <S%H6588><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> my sighs <S%H585><s%> are many, <S%H7227><s%> and my heart <S%H3820><s%> is faint. <S%H1742><s%>
